verses.verse: Then Job <WH347> answered <WH6030> and said <WH559>,
How long will ye vex <WH3013> my soul <WH5315>, and break <WH1792> me in pieces with words <WH4405>?
These ten <WH6235> times <WH6471> have ye reproached <WH3637> me: ye are not ashamed <WH954> that ye make yourselves strange <WH1970> to me.
And be it indeed <WH551> that I have erred <WH7686>, mine error <WH4879> remaineth <WH3885> with myself.
If indeed <WH551> ye will magnify <WH1431> yourselves against me, and plead <WH3198> against me my reproach <WH2781>:
Know <WH3045> now <WH645> that God <WH433> hath overthrown <WH5791> me, and hath compassed <WH5362> me with his net <WH4686>.
Behold, I cry out <WH6817> of wrong <WH2555>, but I am not heard <WH6030>: I cry aloud <WH7768>, but there is no judgment <WH4941>.
He hath fenced up <WH1443> my way <WH734> that I cannot pass <WH5674>, and he hath set <WH7760> darkness <WH2822> in my paths <WH5410>.
He hath stripped <WH6584> me of my glory <WH3519>, and taken <WH5493> the crown <WH5850> from my head <WH7218>.
He hath destroyed <WH5422> me on every side <WH5439>, and I am gone <WH3212>: and mine hope <WH8615> hath he removed <WH5265> like a tree <WH6086>.
He hath also kindled <WH2734> his wrath <WH639> against me, and he counteth <WH2803> me unto him as one of his enemies <WH6862>.
His troops <WH1416> come <WH935> together <WH3162>, and raise up <WH5549> their way <WH1870> against me, and encamp <WH2583> round about <WH5439> my tabernacle <WH168>.
He hath put <WH7368> my brethren <WH251> far <WH7368> from me, and mine acquaintance <WH3045> are verily estranged <WH2114> from me.
My kinsfolk <WH7138> have failed <WH2308>, and my familiar friends <WH3045> have forgotten <WH7911> me.
They that dwell <WH1481> in mine house <WH1004>, and my maids <WH519>, count <WH2803> me for a stranger <WH2114>: I am an alien <WH5237> in their sight <WH5869>.
I called <WH7121> my servant <WH5650>, and he gave me no answer <WH6030>; I intreated <WH2603> him with <WH1119> my mouth <WH6310>.
My breath <WH7307> is strange <WH2114> to my wife <WH802>, though I intreated <WH2589> for the children's <WH1121> sake of mine own body <WH990>.
Yea, young children <WH5759> despised <WH3988> me; I arose <WH6965>, and they spake <WH1696> against me.
All my inward <WH5475> friends <WH4962> abhorred <WH8581> me: and they whom I loved <WH157> are turned <WH2015> against me.
My bone <WH6106> cleaveth <WH1692> to my skin <WH5785> and to my flesh <WH1320>, and I am escaped <WH4422> with the skin <WH5785> of my teeth <WH8127>.
Have pity <WH2603> upon me, have pity <WH2603> upon me, O ye my friends <WH7453>; for the hand <WH3027> of God <WH433> hath touched <WH5060> me.
Why do ye persecute <WH7291> me as God <WH410>, and are not satisfied <WH7646> with my flesh <WH1320>?
Oh that <WH5414> my words <WH4405> were now <WH645> written <WH3789>! oh that <WH5414> they were printed <WH2710> in a book <WH5612>!
That they were graven <WH2672> with an iron <WH1270> pen <WH5842> and lead <WH5777> in the rock <WH6697> for ever <WH5703>!
For I know <WH3045> that my redeemer <WH1350> liveth <WH2416>, and that he shall stand <WH6965> at the latter <WH314> day upon the earth <WH6083>:
And though after <WH310> my skin <WH5785> worms destroy <WH5362> this body, yet in my flesh <WH1320> shall I see <WH2372> God <WH433>:
Whom I shall see <WH2372> for myself, and mine eyes <WH5869> shall behold <WH7200>, and not another <WH2114>; though my reins <WH3629> be consumed <WH3615> within <WH2436> me.
But ye should say <WH559>, Why persecute <WH7291> we him, seeing the root <WH8328> of the matter <WH1697> is found <WH4672> in me?
Be ye afraid <WH1481> of the sword <WH2719>: for wrath <WH2534> bringeth the punishments <WH5771> of <WH6440> the sword <WH2719>, that ye may know <WH3045> there is a judgment <WH1779> <WH1779>.
